snippet: President Obama expanded the campaign against ISIS to include airstrikes in Syria and more American advisers in Iraq, but he sought to distinguish the new action from the wars in Iraq and Afghanistan.
abstract: Pres Obama expands American military campaign against Islamic State in Iraq and Syria to include airstrikes in Syria and more American advisers in Iraq, but seeks to dispel fears that United States is embarking on a repeat of wars in Iraq and Afghanistan; outlines plan that will bolster American training and arming of moderate Syrian rebels to fight militants, and says Saudi Arabia has agreed to provide bases for training those forces.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Jonathan Weisman, Eric Schmitt, Michael D. Shear and Helene Cooper.

lead_paragraph: President Obama expanded the campaign against ISIS to include airstrikes in Syria and more American advisers in Iraq, but he sought to distinguish the new action from the wars in Iraq and Afghanistan.

headline.sub: Looks to Dispel Fears of Repeating Wars in Iraq and Afghanistan
headline.main: Obama, in Speech on ISIS, Promises Sustained Effort to Rout Militants
headline.print_headline: Obama Calls for Sustained Drive to Rout Militants

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
